header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: Orchids, Birthday cakes, School dinners, Other stuff about our senior school, Shopping in East Kent, Shopping in Cambridge, Cambridge University, Plans for the afternoon
header.conv_type: Discussing, explaining, inquiring, advising, anecdote telling, making arrangements

body.u: I had a look at your two orchid plants in the erm in I suppose what you'd call your pantry isn't it?
my under stairs in the kitchen
yeah yeah erm neither look in the best of health erm ha did one of them get a bit cold in the winter?
well they were over at 's house erm so they were in a a really a mainly sort of unheated kitchen and they were quite near the window

but I did pull them back and put them down on the draining board so they weren't fully next to the window and erm I think they did get a bit cold cos as you can see one of the leaves has gone a bit funny in the middle erm

yeah I've got a problem like that with one of my leaves and I know exactly how it happened it was in the bathroom and it put its leaf well its leaf went against the window and it was a bit condensated I think it didn't exactly freeze on the window but I think it got very cold in the end of the leaf

and then I turned it round to try and help it and I think it may have inadvertently stuck its other leaf don't know quite what happened to the other leaf but something happened to it I reckon because it's got a similar mark on it like it's in the m in the middle of the leaf like on yours
yes well mine my leaves wouldn't have been touching anything cold
no but it would been jolly chilly in there wouldn't it?
yes but I mean it didn't touch against anything
so it's not the end so
it must be mine must be the cold atmosphere because
er it's in you couldn't possibly have it touching anything
so if it probably could do with upping the watering a bit and give it a nice biggish drink and then see by tomorrow how much it actually wants then you may have to
if er then you cou you know could discard the water out

well I have been giving it half a cup er well half of that little container while it's been resting erm because it was still in well it was sort of resting I I ended up cutting off the long flower stalk but the flowers were on it for ages and ages
in fact its flowers were still on when it shouldn't have had flowers erm so it may just be confused

I don't know but I put it in that under cupboard because there's a window in there and it's er although it's south-facing it gets shaded by that er a bit shaded by that shrub outside and I don't really have any erm being a terraced house I either have north or south I don't have any east or west was it east the chap we saw?
I don't know but at at erm
it was a side wasn't it that I don't have?
in the bathroom where I keep mine that's
oh it might be west but that man we erm had a er went to the talk from
he was saying he thought preferably the type of windowsills I don't have available
well at least you're not in a back-to-back that'd give
no that would give you fewer options
even fewer options but erm I wouldn't necessarily have bought one of those myself but as they were bought for me
erm you know can't really say I oh I can't have one of those I don't have the right window for it
especially the one that erm er lived in your neighbour's house for a while before he remembered to give it to you
oh yes that's may not have helped helped its early progress
erm I think there's a problem with the two that erm well it was three and it's now two that er we were given at the botanic gardens last year
they look awfully sickly and they've got some really dodgy brown marks on the leaves which I don't think are intended
yes well well those er my two one of them seems to have a little leaf starting to grow

in the middle but it looks a bit well it doesn't look like it's dried but it is a much darker colour but that that's maybe how they are but the other one is er only got a dried bit in the middle really it hasn't sort of brought up a new shoot
so er it's got some new roots cos I thought the knobbly things might turn into something else but they they're roots
so I'm not quite sure about those we'll have to er see how they get on really
mm I have got some little cuttings in the bathroom of a well there's an aluminium plant erm in some water er
they seem far less common than they used to be

no you can't get that so I was trying to keep that one on because it is I I ought to cut the tops off and do them again because they're getting very tall and thin but I'm worried about losing them completely cos I haven't really seen any about

er so and they do seem to like being in water so that's why I've left them like that erm and next to it in another little pot there's some Philodendron I believe it is sweetheart vine plant which erm has heart-shaped leaves for its name and that likes being in water so I've left those cuttings in water for quite a time and I noticed the other day that it's very cheeky one of them erm has put out a a shoot which they do and they ca you can root from those shoots and it's stretched across and stuck its new roots in the other one's water
so they're like in a chain which reminded me of your orchid
that was in the next pot to another orchid in your bathroom and it and it put its roots in its neighbour's pot
and that might be the same one that er put its root on your flannel

oh yes and that's right cos I'd forgotten that yes cos when I was there and the flannel was hanging on the hook a little further down it it seemed to be progressing its root and its root was resting on my flannel
it's a different way of getting your flannel dry having an orchid drink the water off it but er
you know the spiky plants at your house that no sorry not at your house at 's house
there's about half a dozen of them just sitting in water
oh well s s er some are in water and some are in little tiny pots
oh well I think most of them are in water
but they may have got too cold as well
although they normally live in my north face they seem to like it in my north-facing sticky out window
I think they look quite poorly sitting in water I'm thinking about taking them into productive protective custody
you think I should have them taken from me?
well I don't know until you can you know and and I can
until your certified as er somebody who is
when I'm a ca a capable plant mother
I think they don't look very well at the moment
no but I think they belong to the one upstairs possibly
mm I'm having some problems with those myself actually although I have got a lovely tub

and oh the thing I didn't tell you is that I just stuck some in this pot from I had one oh I dunno last ye couldn't have been last year cos last year so little got done the year before last planted it up and it was quite poorly but it it it came on nicely and this year it's put up three of those you know those flowers that shoot on long stems?
oh right really nice substantial ones?

well that one in the bathroom usually has flowers

it's coming on but then I took two babies off when I repotted it and they they look quite sickly
but so I replanted them up again er and so I was just wondering whether I ought to take the other ones or at least I think you should give them some soil I think they've got they caught chlorosis
it's when they lose their their chlorofilm chlor
oh yes they they do look a bit insipid on the other hand they can go red cos they get too cold
they might not be allowed as erm houseplants if they had chloroform in them
no no don't sort of put them and
no yes yes chlorophyll yes I was wondering if I should know what substances they had in them yes
but the erm what do you call them? I think mum used to call them a she called them a money plant the ones with the sort of su the succulents with the round fleshy leaves

that's that's enjoying itself in there it's it looks much better and I should make some little plants out of those

biology that was where biology was
